= Windows Setup =

_FreeSpeech Windows install is in development. Here is what we have so far, if you want to help._

== Cygwin ==

Install [http://cygwin.com/ Cygwin] Linux emulation layer for Windows and run setup.exe to search and install these dependencies:

    * python
    * python-cairo
    * python-gobject
    * python-gobject-devel
    * python-gtk2.0
    * python-gtk2.0-demo
    * python-gtk2.0-devel
    * gtk2.0
    * gstreamer0.10
    * gstreamer0.10-plugins-base
    * gstreamer0.10-plugins-good
    * gstreamer0.10-plugins-pulse
    * libgstreamer0.10-devel
    * libgstreamer0.10_0
    * Xorg
    * Xorg-common
    * cairo
    * xwin

    # Launch xterm: ProgramFiles->CygwinX->xterm
    # Test pygtk: pygtk-demo
    # Test gstreamer: gst-inspect-0.10.exe |grep source

Install

    * libgcc1: GCC compiler support shared runtime
    * libmpfr4: A library for multiple-precision floating point
    * gcc4: GCC Release series 4 compiler (C & C++ install helper)
    * gcc4-core: Core C++ compiler subpackage
    * gcc4-g++: G++ subpackage
    * make: The GNU version of the 'make' utility
    * subversion: A version control system
    * autoconf: Wrapper scripts for autoconf commands
    * libtool: A shared library generation tool
    * automake: Wrapper scripts for automake and aclocal
    * libiconv: GNU character set conversion library and utilities
    * python: Python language interpreter

Download and unpack from http://sourceforge.net/projects/cmusphinx/files
*Do not download the zipfile (22.7MB)* Get sources from Files tab.

    * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/cmusphinx/files/sphinxbase/0.8/sphinxbase-0.8.tar.gz/download pocketsphinx-0.8.tar.gz]
    * [http://sourceforge.net/projects/cmusphinx/files/pocketsphinx/0.8/pocketsphinx-0.8.tar.gz/download sphinxbase-0.8.tar.gz]
    * [http://www.speech.cs.cmu.edu/SLM/CMU-Cam_Toolkit_v2.tar.gz CMU-Cambridge Statistical Language Modeling Toolkit v2]

Copy the archives to C:\cygwin\home\dev or wherever you want to build.

Using xterm, change directory to the folders, unpack, and install
{{{
cd /home/dev
tar xvf sphinxbase*
tar xvf pocketsph*
cd sphinxb*
./configure
make
make install
}}}
Read the README inside the package for instructions.
Continue with FreeSpeech setup.
